what: Export options, bookmarking & ending a session
title: A2TEA.WebApp manual
text: Tables can downloaded .tsv files plots exportable variety formats .pdf, .png, .svg allows easily save share observations results. However, even relatively small set species, like three Poaceae species test data, lead several OGs worthwhile investigate substantiates need bookmarking system outlined Implementation section. quickly becomes valuable simply bookmark e.g. OGs annotated top 5 enriched BP GO terms OGs expanded Hordeum vulgare intention return analysis later time quickly generate list use another tool. Relating previous sub-sections want emphasize bookmarking integral part using A2TEA.WebApp fully featured analysis tabs except “Set analyses”, since individual genes OGs focus. aid bookmarking process also added informative pop-messages indicate instance selected genes/OGs already saved. Since bookmarks can also used export completely functional .RData subset file, relevant information kept processing speed increased relevant results integrative effort kept. instance, analysis turned hypothesis 2 example data (“Expanded barley compared maize”) fact interest anymore, subsetting .RData file interesting OGs hypothesis 1 completely removes unneeded “bloat” hypothesis 2. Similarly, can create 2 .RData files (one hypothesis) run custom script separately, thereby easily producing hypothesis-specific results.

title: Classes & Data Structures
code: #required packages for classes library(readr) library(Biostrings) library(treeio)   # define necessary classes # class for the expanded_OG - containing all different types of data we have on it setClass("expanded_OG", slots=list(blast_table="tbl_df",                                    add_OG_analysis="list"))  # class for the hypothese setClass("hypothesis", slots=list(description="character",                                    number="character",                                   expanded_in ="character",                                    compared_to="character",                                    expanded_OGs="list",                                   species_tree="phylo"))  #class for adding OGs analysis setClass("add_OG_set",          slots=list(genes="spec_tbl_df",                     msa="AAStringSet",                      tree="phylo"                    )          )

title: Classes & Data Structures
text: intend create visualizations want perform analyses underlying data, following provide classes knowledge work proficiently A2TEA.Workflow results. final output generated workflow single .RData file can loaded active R environment load() command. provides several separate objects containing results compact form factor: HYPOTHESES.a2tea - List object one S4 object per hypothesis. S4 object contains several layers nested information. E.g. HYPOTHESES.a2tea$hypothesis_2@expanded_OGs$N0.HOG0001225 refers specific expanded OG S4 data object contains: blast_table (complete BLAST/DIAMOND results OG genes & extended hits) add_OG_analysis (includes multiple sequence alignment (MSA), phylogenetic tree gene info expanded OG additional OGs based best BLAST/DIAMOND hits) HOG_level_list - List object one tibble per hypothesis. Information includes OG, number genes per species, boolean expansion info, number significant DEGs, . last N list element non-redundant superset species analyzed formulated hypotheses. makes easy create comparison set e.g. conserved OGs species hypothesis subset can compared. HOG_DE.a2tea - Tibble DESeq2 results genes + additional columns. A2TEA.fa.seqs - Non-redundant list object containing corresponding amino acid FASTA sequences genes/transcripts final analysis (includes expanded OGs + additional BLAST hits & additional OGs based user-chosen parameters). SFA/SFA_OG_level - gene/transcript level tables contain functional predictions (human readable descriptions & GO terms inferred AHRD). hypotheses - copy user-defined hypotheses definitions underlying workflow run. all_speciesTree - phylogenetic tree species workflow run (non-redundant superset hypotheses) inferred Orthofinder/STAG/Stride.

what: Explore, filter, and visualize gene family expansions and differential expression to identify candidate genes for stress adaptation.
title: Explore, filter, and visualize gene family expansions and differential expression to identify candidate genes for stress adaptation.
text: A2TEA software workflow facilitating identification candidate genes stress adaptation based comparative genomics transcriptomics. combines differential gene expression gene family expansion indicator evolution adaptive traits. goal A2TEA.WebApp allow exploration, highlighting, exporting results generated A2TEA pipeline run. core package Shiny application aims combine phylogenetic, transcriptomic & functional data results, way makes easier generate insightful observations. A2TEA pipeline requires user formulate hypotheses - specific results produced - WebApp allows investigate genomic adaptations one subset investigated species analyzed treatment condition. A2TEA.WebApp aims combine benefits interactivity reproducibility, e.g. capturing genes orthologous groups interest bookmarked user allowing easy export plots, tables complete subsets original input data.

title: Explore, filter, and visualize gene family expansions and differential expression to identify candidate genes for stress adaptation.
text: currently 3 ways using A2TEA.WebApp: - installing development version R package repository devtools/remotes - docker container latest stable release, offer singularity based guide - demo instance App running hosted shinyapps.io allowing sneak peak functionality

title: Explore, filter, and visualize gene family expansions and differential expression to identify candidate genes for stress adaptation.
text: can install development version A2TEA.WebApp GitHub either remotes devtools, e.g.: Note system dependencies might installed: might also need install pandoc: - either terminal conda/mamba conda/mamba install -c conda-forge pandoc - via installer/package manager
code: library(remotes) remotes::install_github("tgstoecker/A2TEA.WebApp",                          dependencies = TRUE,                          build_vignettes = TRUE) apt-get update apt-get upgrade apt-get install -y \     libxml2-dev \     libcairo2-dev \     libgit2-dev \     default-libmysqlclient-dev \     libpq-dev \     libsasl2-dev \     libsqlite3-dev \     libssh2-1-dev \     libxtst6 \     libcurl4-openssl-dev \     unixodbc-dev \     libproj-dev xdg-utils \     --fix-missing

title: Explore, filter, and visualize gene family expansions and differential expression to identify candidate genes for stress adaptation.
text: can also circumvent dependency issues downloading latest release A2TEA Docker image. circumvent potential problems regarding access rights use Singularity pull use image. Note however, require --writable enabled therefore likely require either --fakeroot ---home flag well. command works depend Singularity installation - whether priviliged . sudo rights installed Singularity via systems package manager problem .
code: #pull the image from dockerhub singularity pull a2tea_webapp.sif docker://tgstoecker/a2tea_webapp:latest  #open R console of image in non-persistent but writable mode singularity run --writable --fakeroot a2tea_webapp.sif R #or singularity run --writable --no-home a2tea_webapp.sif R

title: Explore, filter, and visualize gene family expansions and differential expression to identify candidate genes for stress adaptation.
text: WebApp comes test dataset can loaded via clicking “Try demo A2TEA.RData file” top interface. result also computed A2TEA.Workflow usage test. workflow set run three species analysis Hordeum vulgare, Zea mays & Oryza sativa japonica reaction patterns drought stress. Peptide fastas reduced 2000 proteins; sequencing reads subsampled 2M reads. fasta/annotation files sequencing reads hosted - . Fasta & annotation files either downloaded ensemblPlants still possess original name case functional annotations computed using AHRD. NCBI SRA accession IDs sequencing reads: - Hordeum vulgare: SRR6782243, SRR6782247, SRR6782257, SRR6782249, SRR6782250, SRR6782254 - Zea mays: SRR2043219, SRR2043217, SRR2043190, SRR2043220, SRR2043226, SRR2043227 - Oryza sativa japonica: SRR5134063, SRR5134064, SRR5134065, SRR5134066 correspond following studies relating drought stress: - Hordeum vulgare: https://doi.org/10.1186/s12864-019-5634-0 - Zea mays: https://doi.org/10.1104/pp.16.01045 - Oryza sativa japonica: https://doi.org/10.3389/fpls.2017.00580
